WorkItem.Description:
I know this has been brought up before in various issues but I figure i'll mention it again.     Every version that comes out, I have to spend a lot of time updating data.  
 
This last release, most of the tier 10 gear had a location of "sold by     at   " and did not appear in the regular filters.   The only way I could even find them was to make my own "all items" filter and then refresh the items.    I have had to do this for 4-5 toons on a couple of PC's so far and may yet have to for my other alts.  I assume that I am not the only one that has run into this problem as I have had the problem on two separate PC's.    Most of us experienced users just deal with these things as they occur but it would be difficult for new users to even find the items to refresh them.
 
Would it be possible to have a full refresh from armory for each version or something?    I know this is extremely time consuming and may not be feasible.    Are there any other options to help improve this?

Comments.Message:
Quick answer: no
Quick solution: Start a refresh when you go to bed and let it run overnight
Slow Answer: do it for us and post a patch in the patch page

What does "a lot of time" mean? Why do you have to (or think you have to) do anything for '4-5 toons' or 'a couple of PC's'. There is indeed a full refresh that happens each time a release goes out, from Wowhead, since it's generally more reliable.

Maintaining the item cache is a full-time job, figuratively speaking. We do what we can, and would definitely welcome anyone taking on that role.

And you do not have to make your own filters, they are already in the default filters. Make sure "Unknown (Refresh)", Not found on Armoury", and "Other" filters are checked and they should all be there. Also there have been 2 cache patches applied and another 2 to be evaluated since the last release so some of the issues might be fixed with these patches.

Hmmm...  Didn't the WowHead site admin offer help on WowHead <-> Rawr related stuff a while back?  

If there was a means to pull a list of all the items in one download (would be a big file, but it should be a lot faster), that would maybe make the updating easier so that we (and by 'we' I mean 'Astrylian' :p) could actually do a full update before making a release.

Err... Like I said, I already do do a full Wowhead refresh before each release. A refresh from Wowhead is super fast in comparison, only takes like 20min or something. It's armory that takes an hour or few.

Either you're not doing a full wowhead refresh just prior to each release, or if you are, something in your update process is going wrong, or the changes you downloaded aren't making it into the release .zip.

In the run to 2.3.16 I made a change to Tiny Abomination in a Jar item parsing.  
We're now 2 releases later (2.3.16 and 2.3.17).
The item cache tot TAJ still has old data.

manually updating the item from wowhead works as intended.
There was no .16, but yeah, I didn't do a full refresh before this release, because it included a brand new item cache. See the thread about that issue.

2.3.18: TAJ still has old data.
/use [pot of honey]
This is in the realm of the people maintaining the default data files. I believe one of them checked in a new copy of the itemcache, after doing a full refresh, already?
Default cache now has correct TAJ data
